title: Bill Murray (baseball)
summary: William Allenwood Murray (September 6, 1893 – September 14, 1943) was an American professional baseball infielder. In 1917, he played in 8 games with the Washington Senators of Major League Baseball. In 21 at-bats, Murray had no home runs, 4 RBIs and a stolen base. Murray attended Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island and the College of the Holy Cross in Worcester, Massachusetts.
